byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley contributed reporting from Albany.

abstract: David Wildstein, architect of 2013 George Washington Bridge lane closings, testifies he was told New Jersey Gov Chris Christie and New York Gov Andrew Cuomo agreed to falsely claim closings were part of traffic study in order to stem political fallout and protect Christie's reelection chances; Cuomo denies accusation.

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: David Wildstein testified that the governors agreed to issue a report falsely citing a traffic study for closing access lanes to the George Washington Bridge; a Cuomo aide denied the account.
snippet: David Wildstein testified that the governors agreed to issue a report falsely citing a traffic study for closing access lanes to the George Washington Bridge; a Cuomo aide denied the account....

headline.main: Ex-Ally of Christie Links Cuomo to Cover-Up of Lane Closings
headline.print_headline: Witness Connects Cuomo  to Bridge Case Cover-Up
